TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE . At present he is resident in GPE to where he was returned by the NORP authorities . He is represented before the ORG by PERSON Bjørn ORG , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The respondent Government are represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , and ORG PERSON of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant came to GPE in DATE and applied for asylum . In DATE he married a NORP citizen but the marriage only lasted DATE . In DATE he married another NORP citizen . His request for asylum was rejected by the NORP authorities but he received in DATE a residence permit due to the fact that he was married to a NORP citizen . No children have resulted from any of the marriages . His parents as well as QUANTITY sisters still live in GPE whereas other members of his family live in GPE and GPE . While living in GPE the applicant visited GPE CARDINAL times , most recently he spend DATE there in DATE . He experienced no problems while he was there . He received a new NORP passport in DATE .

In DATE the applicant was arrested and charged with narcotics offences , namely for having been in possession of QUANTITY of heroin and QUANTITY of cocaine , for the purpose of passing it on . He was detained on remand . On DATE an indictment was served and the trial commenced in ORG ( byretten ) on DATE . The applicant pleaded guilty to the charges brought against him whereas he opposed the prosecutor ’s request for an expulsion due to the fact that he had lived in GPE since DATE , had been married to a NORP citizen since DATE and since he allegedly risked CARDINAL years’ imprisonment according to NORP law , due to his conviction in GPE , in conditions which would be cruel and inhuman .
By judgment of DATE the applicant was found guilty of the charges brought against him and sentenced to ORG imprisonment . ORG also decided to expel the applicant from GPE for ever .

The applicant appealed against the judgment requesting a more lenient sentence and acquittal as regards the decision to expel him . On DATE the High Court of Eastern Denmark ( PERSON ) upheld ORG judgment in its entirety . As regards the expulsion order ORG stated :

“ Due to the character and extent of the criminal activity concerned ( ORG ) agrees that the requirements for expulsion pursuant to LAW ... are fulfilled . The allegations that ( the applicant ) might perhaps be sentenced to an additional term of imprisonment in GPE for the crimes committed and that serving a sentence in a NORP prison would run counter to the minimum standards of prison conditions acknowledged by GPE do not speak decisively against expulsion . Furthermore , there appears to be no other special reasons speaking in favour of refraining from expulsion pursuant to LAW ... ”
On DATE the applicant applied for leave to appeal to ORG ( Højesteret ) . This was refused on DATE . On DATE the deportation order was carried out .
